tool.name: Extract genomic DNA

validator.message: Sorry, sequences are not currently available for the specified genome. You may want to try the 'Extract genomic DNA using coordinates from assembled genomes' tool.

tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
Make sure that the genome build is specified for the interval dataset you are extracting sequences for (click the pencil icon if it is not specified).
.. class:: infomark
Why do we have two sequence extractors?
* **Extract genomic DNA using coordinates from ASSEMBLED genomes** - will work for most cases when your intervals are located on assembled chromosomes (i.e., chr1, chrX, etc.) * **Extract genomic DNA using coordinates from UNassembled genomes** (this tool) - is designed to work on partially assembled or unassembled genomes when your intervals are located in contigs or scaffolds rather than assembled chromosomes (i.e., super_1 etc.)
These two tools will be merged in the future.
-----
**What it does**
This tool uses coordinate, strand, and build information to fetch genomic DNAs in FASTA format.
-----
**Example**
Input dataset::
super_1 127475281 127475310 NM_000230 0 + super_1 127485994 127486166 NM_000230 0 + super_1 127486011 127486166 D49487 0 +
